flounder.sounds

Class AudioController

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.sounds.AudioController

  • public class AudioController
extends java.lang.Object
    An object which allows other classes to alter the settings of a sound source while playing a certain sound. Whenever a play request is made to the SoundSource an AudioController is returned allowing the source's settings to be updated while the sound is playing. Once the sound has finished playing the controller becomes inactive.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected AudioController(SoundSource source)
      Creates a new controller for the given sound source.

      Indicates that the sound needs to be faded out.

      protected void setInactive()
      Indicates that the source is no longer playing the sound that this controller was created for, rendering the controller inactive.
      protected void setPosition(Vector3f position)
      Sets the position of the source (as long as the source is still playing the sound that this controller was created for).
      protected void stop()
      Stops the source playing the sound.
      protected boolean update(float delta)
      Updates the controller, checking whether the controller is still active.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AudioController

        protected AudioController(SoundSource source)
        Creates a new controller for the given sound source.
        Parameters:
        source - The sound source that this controller can control.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        protected boolean update(float delta)
        Updates the controller, checking whether the controller is still active.
        Parameters:
        delta - The time in seconds since the last frame.
        Returns:
        true if the controller is still active. If the source has stopped playing the sound that this controller was created for then the controller is no longer active and will return false.

      • stop

        protected void stop()
        Stops the source playing the sound.

      • isActive

        protected boolean isActive()
        Returns:
        true if the source that the controller is assigned to is still playing the sound.

      • setInactive

        protected void setInactive()
        Indicates that the source is no longer playing the sound that this controller was created for, rendering the controller inactive.

      • fadeOut

        protected void fadeOut()
        Indicates that the sound needs to be faded out.

      • setPosition

        protected void setPosition(Vector3f position)
        Sets the position of the source (as long as the source is still playing the sound that this controller was created for).
        Parameters:
        position - The new position of the source.

      • getVolume

        protected float getVolume()
        Returns:
        The volume that the sound is currently being played at.
